snippet: At least 35 were killed after battles between Shiite rebels and government-allied tribes northwest of the capital, while in the south gunmen killed six soldiers on patrol, officials reported.
abstract: At least 35 people are killed and 40 others are wounded in Yemen during battles between Shiite rebels and government-allied tribes; Yemen, in addition to threats from an active offshoot of Al Qaeda, faces a secessionist movement in the south and the Houthi rebellion in the north; mediation efforts and cease-fires have failed to end the unrest.
lead_paragraph: At least 35 were killed after battles between Shiite rebels and government-allied tribes northwest of the capital, while in the south gunmen killed six soldiers on patrol, officials reported.

headline.main: Dozens Killed in Yemen as Sectarian Muslim Fighting Intensifies
headline.print_headline: Dozens Killed in Yemen as Sectarian Muslim Fighting Heats Up
